page.title: 08 A Thanet Police Sergeant
page.content: Law and order in our area is maintained by the Kent County Constabulary, in which Rebecca's father is employed as a police sergeant. He has been in the force for seventeen years. He has had experience of other work, in the merchant navy and as a sales manager. Most of his work is routine, though the unexpected can happen and he has to be ready for it. The worst crime he helped investigate was murder: one man shot another while stealing some money. The crime in which most people were involved was a fraud case, involving the arrest of thirty-two people. In his present work, he will have the option of retiring at the age of fifty-five. If he passes the Inspector's exam he will retire at sixty.
